cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 165 mi SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to drift north-northwest, then turn northwest toward the South Carolina/North Carolina coast, with the center reaching the coastline Sunday and then lifting northeast offshore early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the SC/NC border – vicinity of Myrtle Beach to Cape Fear (close to Wilmington, NC)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to south of South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC to Cape Lookout NC (includes Wilmington, NC area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern U.S. coast from South Carolina through eastern North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm conditions with sustained winds around 40–50 mph and higher gusts are expected Saturday night through Sunday at Wilmington, NC.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water levels 1–2 ft above ground at times of high tide along the southeastern North Carolina coast, including the Cape Fear River entrance.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated amounts up to 6 inches possible over coastal southeast North Carolina through the weekend.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large surf and dangerous rip currents impacting port approaches and pilot boarding areas.
